gameplayModel

Class Bomberman

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplayModel.GridObject
      • gameplayModel.AnimatedObject
        • gameplayModel.Bomberman

  • public class Bomberman
extends AnimatedObject
    This class containts the various methods and attribute which allow the game controller to display, manipulate, animate and keep track of all the aspect related to bomberman.
    Author:
    Olivier Laforest

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bomberman

        public Bomberman(int x,
         int y)
        Construtor used to generate bomberman for new games.
        Parameters:
        x - position of bomberman related to the top left corner of the game panel
        y - position of bomberman related to the top left corner of the game panel

      • Bomberman

        public Bomberman(int x,
         int y,
         int invincibilityTimer,
         int bombsLeft,
         java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> powerUpsAcquired)
        Construtor used to generate bomberman when a saved game is resumed.
        Parameters:
        x - position of bomberman related to the top left corner of the game panel
        y - position of bomberman related to the top left corner of the game panel
        invincibilityTimer - time left to bomberman invincibility caused by the Mystery power up
        bombsLeft - number of bomb available left that bomberman can drop on the map
        powerUpsAcquired - list of power ups already acquired by bomberman

    • Method Detail

      • generateAnimationList

        public void generateAnimationList()
        Description copied from class: AnimatedObject
        Marked for deletion
        Specified by:
        generateAnimationList in class AnimatedObject

      • setXPosition

        public void setXPosition(int xPosition)
        This method set the new x position of bomberban while allowing for the misalignment of bomberman's y position with a row. It also ensures that bomberman's horizontal position never gets out of bounds.
        Overrides:
        setXPosition in class GridObject
        Parameters:
        xPosition - new desired x position of bomberman

      • getYPosition

        public int getYPosition()
        Overrides:
        getYPosition in class GridObject

      • setYPosition

        public void setYPosition(int yPosition)
        This method set the new y position of bomberban while allowing for the misalignment of bomberman's x position with a column. It also ensures that bomberman's vertical position never gets out of bounds.
        Overrides:
        setYPosition in class GridObject
        Parameters:
        yPosition - new desired y position of bomberman

      • addPowerUp

        public void addPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
        Parameters:
        powerUp - to be added to the list of acquired power ups.

      • removePowerUp

        public void removePowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
        Parameters:
        powerUp - to be removed from the list of acquired power ups

        public void setPowerUpsAcquired(java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> powerUpsAcquired)
        Parameters:
        powerUpsAcquired - the list of power ups acquired that bomberman's list of power ups acquired should be set to.

      • getPowerUpsAcquired

        public java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> getPowerUpsAcquired()
        Returns:
        bomberman's list of acquired power ups.

      • decreaseInvincibilityTimer

        public void decreaseInvincibilityTimer()
        If bomberman has picked up a power up of type mystery, than this method decreases the time left for bomberman's invincibility.

      • canWallpass

        public boolean canWallpass()
        Returns:
        true if bomberman has a power up of type Wall pass, false otherwise.

      • canDetonateBombs

        public boolean canDetonateBombs()
        Returns:
        true if bomberman has a power up of type Detonator, false otherwise.

      • canBombpass

        public boolean canBombpass()
        Returns:
        true if bomberman has a power up of type Bombpass, false otherwise.

      • canFlamepass

        public boolean canFlamepass()
        Returns:
        true if bomberman has a power up of type Flamepass, false otherwise.

      • isInvincible

        public boolean isInvincible()
        Returns:
        true if bomberman has a power up of type Mystery, false otherwise.

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns:
        bomberman's speed.

      • increaseBombsAvailable

        public void increaseBombsAvailable()
        Increases the number of bomb available to bomberman at any given time.

      • getBombsAvailable

        public int getBombsAvailable()
        Returns:
        the number of bomb available to bomberman at any given time.

      • increaseBombsLeft

        public void increaseBombsLeft()
        Increases the number of bomb available left that bomberman has not already dropped. This happens when a bomb has exploded and become obsolete and therefore is returned to bomberman to be dropped again.

      • decreaseBombsLeft

        public void decreaseBombsLeft()
        Decreases the number of bomb available left that bomberman has not already dropped. This happens when a bomb is dropped by bomberman.

      • getBombsLeft

        public int getBombsLeft()
        Returns:
        number of bomb available left that bomberman can drop

      • toCSVEntry

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toCSVEntry()
        Convert the relevant attribute of bomberman into an arraylist of string in order to be stored in the database.
        Returns:
        list of relevant attribute converted to string
